articles.title: Creating and managing repositories
articles.subtitle: You can create a repository on GitHub to store and collaborate on your project's files, then manage the repository's name and location.

articles.title: Managing your repository's settings and features
articles.subtitle: You can customize your repository, enable or disable optional features for your repository, and manage your repository’s settings.

articles.title: Configuring branches and merges in your repository
articles.subtitle: You can manage branches in your repository, configure the way branches are merged in your repository, and protect important branches by defining the mergeability of pull requests.

articles.title: Working with files
articles.subtitle: Learn how to manage and use files in repositories.

options.title: Ask the community
options.subtitle: Ask questions, swap stories, share ideas on the community forum.

options.title: What's new
options.subtitle: Discover the latest repositories updates on our blog

video.title: View And Manage Your Dependency Graph - GitHub Checkout
video.subtitle:
GitHub dependency graph identifies all upstream dependencies and public downstream dependents of a repository or package.
You can see your project’s dependencies and some of their properties, like vulnerability information.
Hear Sasha Rosenbaum and William Barr discuss dependencies and see Dependency Graph in action!
